titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania CAJS Rar Ms 286: Sharḥ al-Burdah.

note: Title from added title (first flyleaf recto at front of book).

Owners' notes and stamps (first flyleaf recto at front of book, p. [1], 90). One note has the name scrubbed, but the location is Qusṭantinīyah with the date 1226 A.H. (1811 of 1812 CE) (p. [1]). Another note without context contains the name ʻAlī ʻAbd al-Ḥayy Yūsuf (p. [1]).

msIdentifier.repository: Library at the Herbert D. Katz Center for Advanced Judaic Studies

msContents.summary: Commentary on the poem known as al-Burdah by al-Būṣīrī.

persName.#text: Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, 1213?-1296?
بوصيري، شرف الدين محمد بن سعيد، -

name.#text: Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning

supportDesc.extent: iii, 45, i leaves : 167 x 125 (123 x 90) mm bound to 167 x 127 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern pagination added in pencil, upper outer corners; catchwords every verso, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Textblock border-ruled in red; rubrications in red.

binding.p: Bound in black leather with gilded, embossed onlay central diamond-shaped medallion and cornerpieces; blind-tooled frame; bright yellow pastedowns.

origin.p: The copy was completed in Shaʻbān 1150 A.H. (1737 CE) (p. 89).

provenance: Formerly owned by al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Ṣidqī, [1]179? A.H. (1765 of 1766 CE) (stamp, p. [1]).
Formerly owned by al-Sayyid Aḥmad [...]oghlū al-Sayyid Ḥusayn Efendi, 1208 A.H. (1793 or 1794 CE) (note in ink, second flyleaf recto at front of book)
Formerly owned by Muḥammad Nāfiʻ, 1276? A.H. (1858 or 1859 CE) (note in ink and stamps, p. [1], stamps, third flyleaf recto at front of book).
Formerly owned by the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (library bookplate, inside front cover).
